questions.text: Sutton's first Broadway show was "Les Miserables".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Sutton understudied the role of Eponine in the Broadway production, and also was featured in the ensemble. The original run of "Les Miserables" was from March 12, 1987 to May 18, 2003. However, her debut role was in "Grease!" (in 1996), which ran from  May 11, 1994 to January 25, 1998. She played the role of Sandy.

questions.text: What item of furniture did Sutton buy after her Tony win?
questions.explanation:
A couch.

	"And then I bought a couch!" is one of Sutton's better-known quotes. Sutton won the Tony Award for Best Actress in a Musical for her role as Millie in "Thoroughly Modern Millie" in 2002.

questions.text: How many songs did Sutton's character sing in "The Drowsy Chaperone"?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	Janet van de Graaf was a movie star who decided to give up acting because she had fallen in love. She sang "Show Off" and "Bride's Lament", a duet with Robert Martin called "Accident Waiting To Happen" and also a few lines in "Toledo Surprise" . Sutton was nominated for a Tony for her work with the show, but lost to LaChanze. "The Drowsy Chaperone" opened in May, 2006.

questions.text: What song did Sutton sing in the concert of "Funny Girl"?
options: The Music That Makes Me Dance
questions.explanation:
I'm The Greatest Star.

	On September 23, 2002, many of Broadway's leading actresses sang in the concert of "Funny Girl", a musical about Fanny Brice. Also included in the concert were Idina Menzel, Carolee Carmello and Julia Murney.

questions.text: Sutton once owned a pair of mouse slippers.
questions.explanation:
True.

	According to her then-boyfriend Christian Borle, Sutton proudly owned a pair of slippers with fake mouse heads on the ends. Sutton was featured on a makeover show with her sister-in-law Jennifer Cody, where Christian spilled the beans.

questions.text: How is Sutton related to Hunter Foster?
questions.explanation:
He's her brother.

	Hunter Foster has been seen in "Little Shop of Horrors" and "Urinetown", for which he was nominated for a Tony Award. He has also served as a replacement cast member for the musical version of "The Producers". "Little Shop of Horrors" ran from October 2, 2003 to August 22, 2004. "Urinetown" ran from September 20, 2001 to January 18, 2004. "The Producers" opened on April 19, 2001.

questions.text: Sutton had seven fish as pets in September 2003. Which of the choices was NOT one of their names?
questions.explanation:
Daffy.

	It is well known that Sutton enjoys goldfish, and in September 2003 she had Darth, Pepe, Yuna, BBQ,Mad Eye, Kitty and Yuna. Sadly, Darth passed away in August of 2005.

questions.text: Sutton played Sally in a regional production of "Me and My Girl". At what theater did the show play?
questions.explanation:
Pittsburgh Civic Light Opera.

	"Me and My Girl" debuted on Broadway in 1986 at the Marquis Theater, and enjoys even greater success in England. With a revised script by British actor Stephen Fry, the original Broadway cast included Tim Jerome, George S. Irving and Robert Lindsay.

Georgia.

	Sutton and her brother Hunter were born and raised in Georgia. Sutton now makes her home in New York City. She was born on March 18, 1975.

questions.text: Sutton was not originally slated to star in "Thoroughly Modern Millie". Whom did she replace?
questions.explanation:
Erin Dilly.

	Erin Dilly has also been seen in the Broadway productions of "Chitty Chitty Bang Bang", "Follies", "The Boys from Syracuse" and as a replacement cast member of "Into the Woods" where she played Cinderella. Dilly injured herself and could not open with the show, and so Sutton was moved from ensemble to the lead role! "Thoroughly Modern Millie" opened on April 18, 2002 and closed on June 20, 2004.
